steps.title: Access CardioServer
items: In Epic, open the patient chart → click the CardioServer SmartLink/URL.
OR on the desktop, double-click the CardioServer icon.
OR in Citrix Workspace → CardioServer → Open.
On the login page, enter AD username + password.
Confirm header shows Role = Tech User.

qa.q: What if a study doesn’t match a patient?
qa.a: Use Link/Reconcile → search MRN → select correct order.

qa.q: Can I trash an Unconfirmed study?
qa.a: No, only Preliminary can be trashed.

steps.title: Accessing & Navigating EVC
items: Open patient encounter in Epic.
Locate Connect section (Rooming tab or Plan tab).
Start video visit.

qa.q: How do I invite a guest?
qa.a: Enter guest’s name, relationship, and email/phone.

qa.q: What’s the difference between Leave vs End Call?
qa.a: Leave keeps it running; End Call ends it for all (preferred).

steps.title: Logging In & Patient Selection
items: Log into Epic and select the Clin Doc module from the main dashboard.
Trainer Note: Always confirm you are in the correct patient chart before documenting.
Open the Patient List and choose the correct patient.
Trainer Note: Verify identity with two identifiers (name + DOB).

steps.title: Creating & Managing Notes
items: From the patient chart, click the Clinical Documentation tab in the left-hand menu.
Trainer Note: This is the hub for all narrative documentation workflows.
Select Create New Note from the toolbar.
Trainer Note: Templates may be pre-assigned, but confirm before documenting.
Choose the appropriate Note Type (Admission, Progress, or Discharge).
Trainer Note: Selecting the wrong type can cause reporting errors downstream.
Begin typing directly into the note editor.
Trainer Note: Document in real time when possible; templates help save time.

steps.title: Using SmartTools for Efficiency
items: Insert SmartPhrases or SmartLinks to pull patient information automatically.
Trainer Note: This ensures accuracy and reduces repetitive typing.
Review the pre-populated text and make edits where needed.
Trainer Note: Imported data should always be validated before saving or signing.
Save the note using Save/Accept.
Trainer Note: Notes can be saved in progress and finalized later.

steps.title: Flowsheets & Structured Documentation
items: Open the Flowsheets tab from the patient chart.
Trainer Note: Flowsheets allow structured data capture alongside narrative notes.
Select the correct documentation template from the dropdown.
Trainer Note: Templates vary by specialty and encounter type; double-check before documenting.
Enter vital signs and assessments into structured fields.
Trainer Note: Accurate entries feed into decision-support tools and compliance reporting.

steps.title: Linking Orders with Documentation
items: Navigate to the Orders tab.
Trainer Note: Review existing orders before creating new documentation.
Select Add New Order and choose the relevant Order Set.
Trainer Note: Using order sets supports standardized care.
Complete the documentation fields tied to the order.
Trainer Note: Ensure accuracy, as this impacts billing and compliance.

steps.title: Finalizing & Signing Notes
items: Review the complete note, including any imported data.
Trainer Note: Always validate pre-populated sections before finalizing.
Save and sign the note to complete documentation.
Trainer Note: Signed notes are visible to the full care team; drafts remain editable but hidden.

steps.title: Create a SmartPhrase
items: Open a Note editor (e.g., Progress Note) in a patient chart.
Go to Tools → SmartTool Editors → My SmartPhrases.
Click New and enter a short name (used with a period ‘.’ to expand).
Add a description for reference.
Enter the boilerplate text in the Content box. Use *** for fields you fill each time; press F2 to jump between them.
Trainer Note: Templates and SmartPhrases reduce repetitive typing and maintain consistency.
Click Accept/Save.

steps.title: Insert SmartLinks
items: In the SmartPhrase editor or a note, place your cursor where the data should go.
Click Insert SmartLink or use the SmartLink lookup.
Search by keyword (e.g., name, dob, allergies, meds).
Insert the chosen SmartLink. It appears as a placeholder.
Preview in a test patient to confirm the data pulls correctly.
Trainer Note: SmartLinks pull live patient data directly from the chart, ensuring accuracy.
Save the phrase.

steps.title: Use a SmartPhrase in Documentation
items: In a note editor, type ‘.’ followed by your phrase name, then press Space/Enter to expand.
Fill in required sections using F2 to navigate.
Edit text as needed.
Trainer Note: Always review SmartLink data for accuracy before signing.
Save or sign the note when finished.

steps.title: Request a New SmartLink
items: End-users cannot create new SmartLinks.
Identify the exact data you need (e.g., last A1c with date).
Submit a request/ticket to the Epic analyst team.
Analysts create SmartLinks from SmartData Elements (SDEs).
Trainer Note: Properly built SmartLinks ensure consistent data use across reporting, flowsheets, and notes.
